Comment: The Shelby Township Republican announced his entrance into the race Monday, April 7, saying Michiganders have been held back by a lack of strong and competent leadership.  James said Gov. Gretchen Whitmer’s time in office has been marked by “radical, out-of-touch policies that have hurt our families, our communities and our economy.” Whitmer, a Democrat, is term-limited and cannot seek reelection in 2026.

Comment: The amount of effort put into elevating slotkin in the pre-primary period is the biggest thing that comes to mind. There's a reason that she basically had no serious opposition in the primary and its because they made sure the field was cleared for her. Considering that she herself is essentially a 2000s republican it doesn't inspire confidence in the kind of candidates they pick. I think basically the only thing that saved her was that Rogers was also a really bad candidate and even then she only barely eeked out a victory. Against candidates like James who have wider popular appeal I don't think Slotkin-like candidates stand much of a chance.
